intro: Drimia marginata, commonly known as the African rain lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, trumpet-shaped white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has strap-like, grassy leaves that are usually dark green and grow from a bulbous base. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its elegant appearance and ease of care. Drimia marginata prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a versatile choice for many garden environments.
